com.cyc.baseclient.connection

Class CycConnectionImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cyc.baseclient.connection.CycConnectionImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CycConnection

    public class CycConnectionImpl
extends Object
implements CycConnection
    Provides a binary connection and an ascii connection to the OpenCyc server. The ascii connection is legacy and its use is deprecated.

    Collaborates with the CycAccess class which wraps the api functions. CycAccess may be specified as null in the CycConnection constructors when the binary api is used. Concurrent api requests are supported for binary (cfasl) mode. This is implemented by two socket connections, the first being for asynchronous api requests sent to Cyc, and the second for the asychronous api responses received from Cyc.

      • converse

        public Object[] converse(Object message)
                  throws CycConnectionException,
                         CycApiException
        Send a message to Cyc and return the Boolean true as the first element of an object array, and the cyc response Symbolic Expression as the second element. If an error occurs the first element is Boolean false and the second element is the error message string.
        Specified by:
        converse in interface CycConnection
        Parameters:
        message - the api command
        Returns:
        an array of two objects, the first is an response status object either a Boolean (binary mode) or Integer (ascii mode), and the second is the response object or error string.
        Throws:
        IOException - when a commuications error occurs
        CycApiException - when a Cyc API error occurs
        CycConnectionException

      • converse

        public Object[] converse(Object message,
                Timer timeout)
                  throws CycConnectionException,
                         CycTimeOutException,
                         CycApiException
        Send a message to Cyc and return the response code as the first element of an object array, and the cyc response Symbolic Expression as the second element, spending no less time than the specified timer allows but throwing a CycTimeOutException at the first opportunity where that time limit is exceeded. If an error occurs the second element is the error message string.
        Specified by:
        converse in interface CycConnection
        Parameters:
        message - the api command which must be a String or a CycArrayList
        timeout - a Timer object giving the time limit for the api call
        Returns:
        an array of two objects, the first is a Boolean response status object, and the second is the response object or error string.
        Throws:
        IOException - when a communications error occurs
        CycTimeOutException - when the time limit is exceeded
        CycApiException - when a Cyc api error occurs
        RuntimeException - if CycAccess is not present
        CycConnectionException

      • converseBinary

        public Object[] converseBinary(CycList message,
                      Timer timeout)
                        throws CycConnectionException,
                               CycTimeOutException,
                               CycApiException
        Send a message to Cyc and return the response code as the first element of an object array, and the cyc response Symbolic Expression as the second element, spending no less time than the specified timer allows but throwing a CycTimeOutException at the first opportunity where that time limit is exceeded. If an error occurs the second element is the error message string. The concurrent mode of Cyc server communication is supported by Cyc's pool of transaction processor threads, each of which can concurrently process an api request.
        Specified by:
        converseBinary in interface CycConnection
        Parameters:
        message - the api command
        timeout - a Timer object giving the time limit for the api call
        Returns:
        an array of two objects, the first is an Boolean response code, and the second is the response object or error string.
        Throws:
        IOException - when a communication error occurs
        CycTimeOutException - when the time limit is exceeded
        CycApiException - when a Cyc api error occurs
        CycConnectionException

      • inAWTEventThread

        public static boolean inAWTEventThread()

      • converseBinary

        public void converseBinary(Worker worker)
                    throws CycConnectionException,
                           CycTimeOutException,
                           CycApiException
        Send a message to Cyc spending no less time than the specified timer allows but throwing a CycTimeOutException at the first opportunity where that time limit is exceeded. The concurrent mode of Cyc server communication is supported by Cyc's pool of transaction processor threads, each of which can concurrently process an api request. The Worker object notifies the caller when the api response is asychronously received.
        Specified by:
        converseBinary in interface CycConnection
        Parameters:
        worker - a Worker object that notifies the caller when work is done
        Throws:
        IOException - when a communication error occurs
        CycTimeOutException - when the time limit is exceeded
        CycApiException - when a Cyc api error occurs
        CycConnectionException - when a communication error occurs or the time limit is exceeded

      • sendBinary

        public void sendBinary(Object message)
                throws CycConnectionException
        Sends an object to the CYC server. If the connection is not already open, it is opened. The object must be a valid CFASL-translatable: an Integer, Float, Double, Boolean, String, or cyc object.
        Parameters:
        message - the api command
        Throws:
        IOException - when a communication error occurs
        CycConnectionException

                           throws IOException,
                                  CycApiException
        Sends a binary (cfasl) api response to a cyc server. This method prepends a status object (the symbol T) to the message.
        Parameters:
        message - the given binary api response
        Throws:
        IOException - when a communication error occurs
        CycApiException - when a Cyc API error occurs

      • resetTaskProcessorById

        public void resetTaskProcessorById(Integer id)
                            throws CycApiException,
                                   CycConnectionException
        Resets the Cyc task processor which is currently processing the api-request specified by the given id. If none of the task processors is currently processessing the specified api-request, then the reset request is ignored. When reset, the Cyc task processor returns an error message to the waiting client thread. The error message consists of "reset\nTHE-API-REQUEST".
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the api-request which is to be interrupted and cancelled
        Throws:
        CycApiException - when a Cyc API error occurs
        IOException - when a communication error occurs
        CycConnectionException

      • resetTaskProcessorById

        public void resetTaskProcessorById(int id)
                            throws CycApiException,
                                   CycConnectionException
        Resets the Cyc task processor which is currently processing the api-request specified by the given id. If none of the task processors is currently processessing the specified api-request, then the reset request is ignored. When reset, the Cyc task processor returns an error message to the waiting client thread.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the api-request which is to be interrupted and cancelled
        Throws:
        CycApiException - when a Cyc API error occurs
        IOException - when a communications error occurs
        CycConnectionException
